channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Slingshot spiders rely on good vibrations to catch supper
item.description: The tiny ray spider uses launches its web to grab its prey out of the air. Though common practice in the superhero world, this ability is actually unusual in spiders.
item.content:encoded: The tiny ray spider uses launches its web to grab its prey out of the air. Though common practice in the superhero world, this ability is actually unusual in spiders.
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: How measles, whooping cough and worse could roar back on RFK Jr.'s watch
item.description: With anti-vaccine activist Robert F. Kennedy Jr. in charge of the nation's biggest health agency, it wouldn't take much tampering to enable vaccine-preventable diseases to make a comeback.
item.content:encoded:
With anti-vaccine activist Robert F. Kennedy Jr. in charge of the nation's biggest health agency, it wouldn't take much tampering to enable vaccine-preventable diseases to make a comeback.

(Image credit: Jabin Botsford/The Washington Post)
item.dc:creator: Arthur Allen

item.title: A cancer survivor nearly died trying to prove he had recovered
item.description: In this week's StoryCorps, two friends recall a harrowing ski trip in the Colorado mountains.
item.content:encoded: In this week's StoryCorps, two friends recall a harrowing ski trip in the Colorado mountains.
item.dc:creator: Max Jungreis

item.title: The manhunt for the New York CEO's shooter enters its third day
item.description: The manhunt for the person who fatally shot the head of one of the country's largest health insurers in New York City entered its third day Friday as police parsed newly discovered clues.
item.content:encoded:
The manhunt for the person who fatally shot the head of one of the country's largest health insurers in New York City entered its third day Friday as police parsed newly discovered clues.

(Image credit: Alex Kent)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Who or what else did President Biden pardon? Find out in the quiz!
item.description: Also in your grab bag of weekly trivia: martial law, bitcoin, the first lady's holiday décor, a Kennedy who's not RFK Jr., brain rot and the popemobile.
item.content:encoded: Also in your grab bag of weekly trivia: martial law, bitcoin, the first lady's holiday décor, a Kennedy who's not RFK Jr., brain rot and the popemobile.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: With the Voting Rights Act facing more threats, advocates renew a push for state laws
item.description: With efforts to bolster the federal Voting Rights Act unlikely under Republican control of the new Congress, advocates are refocusing on state protections against racial discrimination in elections.
item.content:encoded:
With efforts to bolster the federal Voting Rights Act unlikely under Republican control of the new Congress, advocates are refocusing on state protections against racial discrimination in elections.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: Want a great photo of yourself? Try these confidence-boosting poses
item.description: Anyone can be photogenic. It just takes practice. A model and a posing coach share postures and movements to help you get more comfortable in front of the camera.
item.content:encoded:
Anyone can be photogenic. It just takes practice. A model and a posing coach share postures and movements to help you get more comfortable in front of the camera.

(Image credit: NPR)
item.dc:creator: Margaret Cirino

item.title: Microfeminism: The next big thing in fighting the patriarchy
item.description: People are sharing the different tactics they use help to uplift women in small ways.
item.content:encoded:
People are sharing the different tactics they use help to uplift women in small ways.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: After a shocking shooting, Americans vent feelings about health insurance
item.description: The death of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson triggered a deluge of painful stories about health care denials on social media.
item.content:encoded:
The death of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson triggered a deluge of painful stories about health care denials on social media.

(Image credit: Stephen Maturen)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: 3 climbers from the U.S. and Canada are believed to have died in New Zealand
item.description: Three mountain climbers — two from the U.S. and one from Canada — missing for five days on Aoraki, New Zealand's tallest peak, are believed to have died in a fall, the authorities said Friday.
item.content:encoded:
Three mountain climbers — two from the U.S. and one from Canada — missing for five days on Aoraki, New Zealand's tallest peak, are believed to have died in a fall, the authorities said Friday.

(Image credit: Mark Baker)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
